parties.raw_snippet: This Commercialization and License Agreement (this “Agreement”) is made effective as of December 17, 2019 (the “Effective Date”) by and between Vyera Pharmaceuticals, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Vyera”), and CytoDyn Inc., a Delaware corporation (“CytoDyn”).
parties.reasoning: The introductory paragraph explicitly identifies the contracting entities and their legal forms and short names; these are the primary parties to the Agreement.

contract_type.raw_snippet: CytoDyn hereby grants to Vyera, and Vyera hereby accepts, an exclusive royalty-bearing license (or sublicense, as the case may be), under the CytoDyn Patents, the CytoDyn Know-How and the Inventions (if any) solely to Commercialize, use, have used, offer for sale and sell Licensed Products in the Field in the Territory.
contract_type.reasoning: Substance of the agreement: CytoDyn grants Vyera an exclusive royalty-bearing license to intellectual property (Patents, Know-How, Inventions) to commercialize, offer for sale and sell the Licensed Product in the Field and Territory. The primary economic/core obligations are an IP license from CytoDyn and commercialization obligations/payments (royalties/milestones) from Vyera, so this is principally a license agreement with commercialization obligations.

notice_period.reasoning: The contract does not include any clause that establishes an advance notice period to prevent automatic renewal (there is no auto-renewal clause). The Agreement's Term is defined to expire at the end of the Royalty Term; termination-at-will notice periods (e.g., Section 11.2(c) 180 days' notice) are present but are not notice-to-prevent-renewal language, so this field is empty.

expiration_date.raw_snippet:
The term of this Agreement (“Term”) shall commence upon the Effective Date and, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this Article 11, shall expire on the last day of the Royalty Term.

“Royalty Term” means the time period beginning with the First Commercial Sale of the Licensed Product in the Territory and continuing until the latest of (a) the expiration of the last Valid Claim Covering the Licensed Product and included in a CytoDyn Patent licensed to Vyera under this Agreement, (b) the date that is ten (10) years from the date of the First Commercial Sale, (c) the expiration of any Regulatory Exclusivity with respect to the Licensed Product and (d) the Biosimilar Entry Date.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 11.1 defines the Term as expiring on the last day of the Royalty Term. Section 1.94 defines "Royalty Term" as a relative period tied to First Commercial Sale and the latest of several listed events. This is a relative/conditional termination (not a fixed calendar date).
expiration_date.normalized_value: expire on the last day of the Royalty Term (Royalty Term = period beginning with the First Commercial Sale and continuing until the latest of (a) expiration of the last Valid Claim covering the Licensed Product licensed to Vyera, (b) ten (10) years from the date of the First Commercial Sale, (c) expiration of any Regulatory Exclusivity for the Licensed Product, and (d) the Biosimilar Entry Date)

renewal_term.reasoning: The Agreement contains no explicit automatic renewal clause or specified renewal term. It defines a term tied to the Royalty Term and contains termination rights, but no renewal period or automatic renewal mechanics are stated.
